alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 11:41AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MDT/245 PM CDT/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following county, Cherry. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MDT Wednesday /245 PM CDT Wednesday/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1039 AM MDT /1139 AM CDT/, The public reported Minor flooding along Minnechaduza Creek. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Minor flooding along Minnechaduza Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crookston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
